args: A city in the Kingdom of Alberia:\nAt the gates of the manse of Count Dian

A letter of introduction? Hum-hum, I see.
Indeed, the mark on the sealing wax does
bear the the crest of House Delchi, with
whom my master has friendly relations.
So can we meet with the count now?
Regrettably, sir, my master has ordered\nthat no guests be permitted in the manse.

It's going to be harder to get near
him than we thought—and after all
the trouble I went through forging
that introduction letter!
An inn near the manse of Count Dian...

(Ramiel, this is Sandalphon.
We've ascertained the identity of the
count who obtained the gaolstone
from the black marketeer.)
(Apparently this count has been referring\nto himself as ＂the rightful ruler of the\nsouth＂ for some time now.)

(We can extrapolate from this that the
count's aim is an exercise of military
force in order to eliminate the entire
royal family of Alberia.)

(Highly likely. While the veracity of the
count's words is unknown at present, it's
clear he considers the Alberian royal
family an obstacle.)
(Then I ask you to proceed urgently.\nAccording to information we obtained...)
Contact attempt failed. Looks like our only\nrecourse is to hang around and wait for the\ncount to show his true colors.

Time may not be a luxury we can afford.
In a few days, there will be a conference
in the capital where the royal family and
influential nobles will all be gathered.
Hot damn! That means the count can take\nout all the kingdom bigwigs at once!
Which is why Sandalphon told us to\nacquire the artifact before that happens—\neven if it requires less-than-subtle means.
As in forcing things a bit, yeah?\nOkay, then. I'm gonna break into this\nguy's digs tonight. You keep watch.
You intend to sneak in alone?
Less chance of being noticed that way.\nPlus, if things go south, you're still around\nto finish the job.
Very well. However, you must promise\nme that you will NOT press further than\nnecessary with the investigation.
If you learn anything of use, you must\nreturn to me and report. Understood?
All right, infiltration successful.\nNow, where to start looking?
Goodness, look at the time!\nI must see to my master at once.
So if this thing's as valuable as folks say,\nthe count will keep it close.
Just move the script for ＂The Archer of\nSpellcurve＂ from the fifth to the first\nshelf, and...
Well, isn't that a trip! There's a secret\npassage behind the bookshelf.
Only makes sense to have a hidden lair\nwhen you're up to no good. I'd better\nskedaddle out of here and tell Ramiel.
From my perspective, you have much yet\nto learn—I would have you reflect on that.
Hell, even a kid could just go TELL him.\nIt's a full-fledged adult who takes care\nof the work that comes after!
Seems like a natural tunnel.\nBut how long is it?
Ah, there's Count Dian—and those other\ngoons must be his little private army.
This continent was united and ruled\nby my ancestor, Dane the Conqueror!

I shall carry on the will of my progenitor!
With this gaolstone, I shall scorch the land
free of those Alberian royal mites and
wrest back that which by rights is mine!
Sheesh, those guys are REALLY\ninto his speech... Wait. Uh oh.
I was under the impression that you had\nrespectfully refrained from entering our\nhumble domicile, sir.
Hrgh! I suppose you would be a little better\ntrained than Zardon and his boys.
I'll just have to break out a little trick\nI know... Surprise, suckers!
A light! A light you sods!\nGet a new lig—HRK!
What in the blazes is going on?!
Master, I have a new light.
ALL my soldiers are wiped out?!\nHow did you even DO that?!
Simple! I just watched their movements\nwith my eye that was used to the dark.
Ah, I see. So that's why you cover one of\nyour eyes. Clever.
Are you a spy for the kingdom?\nI will grant you the special honor of\nbecoming my vassal.
Sorry, but Papa Bear is pretty devoted\nto a little lady called Goddess Ilia.
Oh, and as you're out of soldiers now,\nbe a good lad and hand over that\nstolen artifact.
Hmph. I may have no personnel left,\nbut it should prove little trouble.
You're gathering mana into the gaolstone?!
Behold your punishment, you fool!\nBy the might of a true conqueror,\nbe scorched to an unsightly husk!
That thing's melting ROCKS! I'm a goner\nfor sure if it manages to touch me.
Aaaah ha ha ha! You can only dodge me\nfor so long, knave!
(It's not hard to avoid the heat rays\nif I follow where his eyes go...)
(There's an opening after he fires\none ray and before the next.\nI'll go for that aaand...)
Checkmate. Oh, and I'll take\nthat gaolstone to go, thanks.
Heh. I can't wait to see the look of shock\non Ramiel's face now.
Huh? Oh, hell! The stone melted all the\nrock and now the cave is collapsing!
